Container.Name: CrashPlan
Container.Overview:
<img src='http://i.imgur.com/FEDXhd6.png' width='120px'><br><br>
With unlimited, set-it-and-get-at-it backup to multiple destinations, plus anywhere, anytime access to ALL your files, CrashPlan is the simplest, surest way to protect your digital life.[br][br]
Container.Description:
<img src='http://i.imgur.com/FEDXhd6.png' width='120px'><br><br>
With unlimited, set-it-and-get-at-it backup to multiple destinations, plus anywhere, anytime access to ALL your files, CrashPlan is the simplest, surest way to protect your digital life.[br][br]

Config.Name: Config Directory
Config.Description: In this directory, CrashPlan will store it's configuration files.

Config.Name: Backup Destination
Config.Description: In this path, CrashPlan will store the backup files

Config.Name: Service Port
CrashPlan Control Port
Config.Description: Used by the CrashPlan Desktop to connect to the CrashPlan service.<br> <span class='label-important'>Note:</span> Please note that this setting is only important <b>IF</b> you change your network type to <b>Bridge</b>, which is highly discouraged.<br>

Config.Name: WebUI Port
Config.Description: This is the WebUI Port. If the port is already used by other service, you can freely change it.

Config.Name: VNC Password
Config.Description: If you want to protect your WebUI, please define a password here.

Config.Name: VNC Server Port
Config.Description: This container exposes a VNC Server usually hosted on port 4239. If you need, you can change it accordingly.

Config.Name: Unassigned Devices
Config.Description: Map Unassigned Devices disks to the container.
